Articles.Content:
I'm playing KSP v 0.90 on a Macbook.

Whenever my engines overheat, my computer overheats.

Whenever I run out of electric charge, my battery goes dead.

Is this normal? What should I do about it?
Your computer is possessed, the only way to save it is to destroy the hipster spirits within then sacrifice a goat.

Make sure that your spacecraft always have enough solar panels and RTGs and never run any engine other than the ion engine over 50 % thrust. This should allow you to use your computer without ever having to charge or cool it ever again.
Add some solar panels or RTGs to your Mac, should help with the charge problem. Dunno about the overheating... Did you stack your Macbook directly under an orange tank?
If I stick a bunch of Gigantors on my crafts, can I keep my computer charged?

> 
> I'm playing KSP v 0.90 on a Macbook.
> Whenever my engines overheat, my computer overheats.
> 
> Whenever I run out of electric charge, my battery goes dead.
> 
> Is this normal? What should I do about it?

 eeloominiti confirmed (wow really that's pretty strange) one more reason to make good rockets
save up and get a pc.

> 
> eeloominiti confirmed (wow really that's pretty strange) one more reason to make good rockets

Speaking of eeloo I found a pretty strange surface anomaly there. I actually did a thread on it.
Your computer has achieved a rare connection with the cosmos that few will ever get to experience. Be proud!

Enjoy it.

Just DON'T crash an LV-N. Especially not while playing in a crowded area.

Call a computer technician and ask him to remove all the cat fur and dirt from radiators. Also, you might ask him to replace that thermal grease, that keeps heat transfer from CPUs to radiators efficient.

Overheat problems are usually caused by dirt and fur on radiators and fans. And battery problems are caused by fans running at 110% due overheating.
